definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Sleep enuresis is a fancy term for bed-wetting.
sentences.chinese: 遗尿症是尿床的术语解释。

sentences.english: It is used to treat rheumatism and enuresis of children as a folk medicine in China.
sentences.chinese: 民间多用于治疗风湿性关节炎和小儿遗尿症。

sentences.english: The pleasant tasting soft tablets dissolve almost instantly in the mouth. Temporarily relieves the symptoms of involuntary urination (common bed-wetting) in children.
sentences.chinese: 良好的口味在嘴里迅速溶化，缓解儿童的遗尿症状。

sentences.english: Objective To research therapy method of enures is.
sentences.chinese: 目的探索遗尿症的治疗方法。

sentences.english: Conclusion Plaster-pressure at ear points is quite effective for childhood enuresis.
sentences.chinese: 结论耳穴敷贴治疗小儿遗尿症有较好疗效。

sentences.english: Also, there was no difference in the amount of vasopressin between the two enuretic groups.
sentences.chinese: 而且在两个遗尿组的加压素的数量没什么不同。

sentences.english: Enuresis is a common pediatric diseases in children. Dr.
sentences.chinese: 小儿遗尿症是儿科常见病。

sentences.english: Symptomatic Relief of Common Bedwetting in Children. No side effects.
sentences.chinese: 缓解儿童日常的遗尿症状，没有副作用。

sentences.english: After a further five-year-old children are bed-wetting, called enuresis patients.
sentences.chinese: 再是五岁以后的孩子尿床，这叫患遗尿症。

sentences.english: Professor Zhang Shiqing summary treatment of the experience of enuresis in children.
sentences.chinese: 总结张士卿教授治疗小儿遗尿的经验。

definition: illness having to do with obstruction of urine flow/(Chinese medicine)/retention of urine
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
